content.rendered:
Community and technical colleges are a crucial talent supply pipeline in California’s economy—and are bound to become even more important as employment patterns shift post COVID-19.

This panel will explore how employers and two-year institution leaders can partner effectively to deliver opportunities to all students. We’ll explore trends in the COVID-era along with opportunities to bring more jobs to recent graduates in California.


Join us for a discussion of:

  • How employers are expanding local and national recruiting efforts to students at California community and technical colleges
  • The benefits of a robust network to grow employer partnerships, employment outcomes, and job-focused education
  • The shifting landscape of recruiting during COVID-19

Featured Speakers::

  • Christine Cruvergara — VP, Higher Education and Student Success, Handshake
  • Drew Douglass — Senior Dean of Workforce and Economic Development, Contra Costa Community College District
  • Dr. Miloni Gandhi — Faculty – Workforce and CTE, Foothill College

excerpt.rendered: A Conversation with Leaders in Workforce Development
